content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::Markdown.MD)
    code_blocks = []
    for element in md.content
        if isa(element, Markdown.Code) && element.language == "julia"
            push!(code_blocks, element.code)
        end
    end
    return join(code_blocks, '\n')
end
```
This function `extract_julia_code` takes a `Markdown.MD` object as input and returns a string containing all the Julia code blocks present in the document. It iterates through each element in the markdown content, checking if it is a `Markdown.Code` object with the language set to "julia". If it is, the code block is added to a `code_blocks` array. After checking all elements, the function returns a single string by joining all the code blocks with a newline character.
